Plugin instructions from 2014


Download the jar from here:

[https://community.microfocus.com/t5/Identity-Manager-Tips/Designer-association-modifier-plugin/ta-p/1774850](https://community.microfocus.com/t5/Identity-Manager-Tips/Designer-association-modifier-plugin/ta-p/1774850)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

  

Rename from .zip to .jar

  

Put here:

C:\netiq\idm\apps\Designer\plugins

  

Restart Designer and see instructionsb below.

  

Sample filter:

![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/af5f6f47-41a8-42f9-bab3-4dcc34a04daf)

Old DA Modifyer instructions

http://www.npsh.hu/download/DAModifier12.zip

  

 - Open Up the Novell Login client

 - Enter the IP of the server

 - Get the context

 - Put in the Servername of the IP you put above

 - Enther the username and password

  

Open DAModifier once you are connected.

 - Enter the tree you want, the association you want, and then choose what to do with that association.

  

---

  

  

  

# Designer association modifier plugin

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/9bcb12e8-8b9b-486d-9c39-a9ff80190d73)](https://community.microfocus.com/members/stefaanv)[stefaanv](https://community.microfocus.com/members/stefaanv)

0 Likes

over 1 year ago

By: scauwe

  

#### Introduction

  

You all know the [DAModifier tool](http://www.novell.com/coolsolutions/tools/15754.html)? Nice tool, but it depends on the Client and Windows. Attached is a designer plug-in that allows you to do similar actions: import, modify or export IDM driver associations.

#### Installation

  

Cool tools does not allow upload of jars, so rename the attached zip to .jar and copy the jar to the plugins folder of your designer. Delete any previous version you had installed and restart designer if already running. I tested this with Designer 4.0.1 and 4.0.2 in Linux and Windows. Version 0.4 was tested with Designer 4.6 LDAP and non-LDAP.

#### Usage

  

Right click on a driver object in the outline view or the driver connection in the modeler view and select Live ? Association Editor or right click on the application (in modeler or outline view) and select Driver ? Live ? Association Editor.

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/79c8b357-107c-407c-850d-c583293cf267)  
](https://www.netiq.com/communities/cool-solutions/cool_tools/generic-file-driver-gfd-idm-v-1-1/associationeditormenu/)

New menu entry: Association Editor

  

A dialogue will pop-up where you can select what you want to do.

#### Export associations.

  

Export associations will export the associations of the selected driver to a tab separated file. This file will contain the object DN (lpdap format), the associations state and the association value. Enter the required information (search base, ldap filter, association status and the target file) and press Start.

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/cb26a248-1c4b-4675-b3fa-ba7aa19fdcf7)  
](https://www.netiq.com/communities/cool-solutions/cool_tools/generic-file-driver-gfd-idm-v-1-1/associationeditorexport/)

Export associations dialog

  

  

#### Modify associations

  

This allows modification of the association status. Enter the required information (search base, ldap filter, 'from' association status, 'to' association status) and press Start. Optionally, a log file is generated. This log file (tab separated) contains the object DN, the old state, the association value and the action taken.

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/5781297a-f9b7-4db0-9789-95ba696c0c70)  
](https://www.netiq.com/communities/cool-solutions/cool_tools/generic-file-driver-gfd-idm-v-1-1/associationeditormodify/)

  

Modify associations dialog

  

  

#### Import associations

  

This allows for importing associations. Enter the required information (file to import) and press Start. Optionally, you can limit the import to a 'test only'. This will generate a log file of the actions it would take. The file to import is a tab separated file with the following columns: object dn (ldap), association state, association value (same format as the export option). Optionally (unless 'validate only' is checked) a log file is generated. This log file (tab separated) is the same as the input file, but adds an action column containing the action taken (or that would be taken in case of 'validate only'). Note: when 'validate only' is not selected, importing will always delete the current associations for the object. It does not add associations to the existing objects.

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/78a6b30d-4a3d-420c-ba62-317a1c2c16d6)  
](https://www.netiq.com/communities/cool-solutions/cool_tools/generic-file-driver-gfd-idm-v-1-1/associationeditorimport/)

  

Import associations dialog

  

  

#### Processing

  

After pressing start, a monitor dialog is displayed, showing the progress. Upon completion, a summary dialog is shown. Note: processing can be run in the background, allowing you to continue your work. The progress view will display the result. Clicking the link will display the same summary as above (when running in the foreground).

[![](https://www.evernote.com/shard/s6/sh/31fd6b56-2c96-42e6-8d77-7229c22ad041/496bad3b97f370a38e7954443e33dfa4/res/b612522a-dacf-40d8-b98a-b4d4d519e502)  
](https://www.netiq.com/communities/cool-solutions/cool_tools/generic-file-driver-gfd-idm-v-1-1/associationeditorstatus/)

  

Job status

  

  

#### New features and fixes

  

Version 0.4, 04-Feb-2018

  

- Made the plugin compatible with the LDAP Designer. Tested with IDM 4.6 LDAP and non LDAP.
    

  

  

[Version 0.3.1](https://community.microfocus.com/cfs-file/__key/communityserver-wikis-components-files/00-00-00-01-39/associationEditorStatus_2D00_500x68.png), 23-June-2015

  

- Bug fix: fixed issue with backslash during import of associations.
    

  

  

[Version 0.3.0](https://community.microfocus.com/cfs-file/__key/communityserver-wikis-components-files/00-00-00-01-39/associationEditorStatus_2D00_500x68.png), 21-June-2015

  

- Bug fix: fixed NPE during import of associations.
    

  

  

[Version 0.2.0](https://community.microfocus.com/cfs-file/__key/communityserver-wikis-components-files/00-00-00-01-39/associationEditorStatus_2D00_500x68.png), 5-March-2014

  

- Bug fix: fixed issues with modifying the state of not-associated objects.
    

  

- Enh.: remember last settings.
    

  

  

Version 0.1.0, 14-SEPT-2012

  

- First release (beta).
    

  

  

#### Know limitations

  

ldap paged search is somehow not fully implemented in eDirectory. Some ldap searches will return duplicate entries when using paged searches. This is a known eDirectory issue. In order to work around this somehow, the search is sometimes split up into multiple searches. Still, no guarantee is given that objects will not be synchronized twice.

#### Comment
